title: [Self-Directed] Designing Mathematics Education Strategies Using Social Robots

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic mathematics curriculum concepts, experience with digital device utilization, experience in designing educational programs within organizations
context.additional_context: Workshop for strengthening the capacity to design mathematics education programs for corporate managers/leaders. Exploring the educational integration potential of social robots in VR simulation environments that mimic real classroom settings.

learning_goals: Learners analyze the educational functions of social robots and propose three or more strategies for integrating them into existing mathematics curricula.
Learners develop five or more evaluation metrics to assess the effectiveness of robot-assisted instruction in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can explain the impact of robot-assisted instruction on learners' moral reasoning development through learning outcome analysis.
Learners identify three or more potential barriers to technology integration in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments and propose solutions.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
